Comment: 8 pillars focused on health preparedness and response

Appeal Name: Global Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan
Comment: over USD 43.4 million are to cover interventions in Eastern, Western and Southern Africa; more than USD 24.5 million are to be dedicated to the Asia-Pacific region; more than USD 17 million are for the Middle East and Northern Africa; over USD 13.6 million are for the Americas and, the remainder will support activities in Europe and Central Asia, as well as global interventions.

Appeal Name: Coronavirus emergency appeal UNHCR’s preparedness and response plan
Comment: These requirements are fully represented in the GHRP

WFP is appealing to government partners to accelerate an estimated $1.9 billion of contributions to enable the urgent procurement and pre-positioning of buffer stocks so that at least three months of assistance can be provided in fragile places.

Appeal Name: A UN framework for the immediate socio-economic response to COVID-19
Comment: The collective know-how of the United Nations’ 131 Country Teams – serving 162 countries and territories – is being mobilized to implement this framework over the next 12 to 18 months.

Appeal Name: COVID-19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Program (SPRP)

Comment: 122 National Societies (will prioritise them and provide support to weakest health systems first)

The ICRC is appealing for 250 million Swiss francs (256 million US dollars) to respond in places of conflict and violence, to support medical facilities and places of detention, curb the spread among and ensure medical access for displaced people and detainees, and to support National Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies in their response.
